title:
Undecidability of expansions of Laurent series fields by cyclic discrete
  subgroups
abstract:
In 1987, Pheidas showed that the field of Laurent series $\mathbb{F}_q((t))$
with a constant for the indeterminate $t$ and a predicate for the natural
powers $\{t^n \mid n > 0\}$ of $t$ is existentially undecidable. We show that
the same result holds true if $t$ is replaced by any element $\alpha$ of
positive $t$-adic valuation.
